title: Starbucks’ China Sales Slow With Covid-19 Bout
sub_head: Coffee chain says U.S. sales growing, boosts employee pay
body:
Starbucks Corp. said its U.S. sales were strong during its most recent quarter, though the pandemic’s resurgence in China dragged on the coffee giant’s revenue.
For its fourth quarter ended Oct. 3, Starbucks said Thursday that U.S. same-store sales were up 22% compared with the same period last year, and up 11% over pre-pandemic levels. But same-store sales in its key China market fell 7% in the quarter compared with last year’s period.
